Is it out of your scope or you will schedule in your roadmap?

items.title: IMS pager download all of the content, not just one page data
items.body:
My team members recognized, that the pager function in the ..\IMS\ download all of the contents in the fist time, and just the frontend show it in little packs. 
It means, that many thousand of content maybe will kill this function. 
Our suggestion is the backend download just little packs, which the frontend needs. 

For the testing here you are some testuser import file sample. 
[testusers.csv.txt](https://github.com/SenseNet/sn-webpages/files/1600839/testusers.csv.txt)

items.title: Review unimplemented permission query parameters
items.body:
There are some permission action parameters that (based on some code comments) seems to be unimplemented for a while. Based on the generated client code, they are required for action calls. We should talk about cleaning up this API by removing these or at least making them optional with a default parameter.

The actions and their parameters are the following:

**GetRelatedIdentities**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedPermissions**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet
 - explicitOnly - The value "true" is required because "false" is not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedItems**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet
 - explicitOnly - The value "true" is required because "false" is not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedIdentitiesByPermissions**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet

**GetRelatedItemsOneLevel**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet

items.title: Port exceptions from Services
items.body:
Move the base exception class (_RepositoryException_) from Services here with a more generic name. Its main feature is to hold an error number (_eventid_) that can be different for each derived exception class.

- [ ] ExceptionBase abstract class
- [ ] move general-purpose child classes from Services (SnNotSupported, Configuration, etc.)
- [ ] handle ReflectionTypeLoad exception in a smarter way when logging exceptions
- [ ] use error number (eventid) from ExceptionBase when logging exceptions (_SnLog.WriteException_)

items.title: Cannot download mp3 files
items.body:
Audio files (**.mp3**) can be uploaded, but **cannot be downloaded**. The system gives a 404 error.

### Issues
#### Serving mp3 files

In the web.config file there is a list of handlers by extension. Unfortunately this is a static list, Asp.Net does not allow us to provide this list dynamically, so we have to add new lines manually. Look for the line defined for mp4 files (mp4Handler), make a copy of that line and define a similar line for mp3 files. The goal is to let the system know that these files should be handled by our _static file handler_ that is able to serve files from the repository.

#### File content type (MIME type)

When you upload a file, we try to determine its content type – currently by its extension. This is managed by the _MimeTable.GetMimeType_ method in the Storage project. We have a static, hardcoded **mime table** that actually contains mp3, but with **multiple content types**. We return **only the first one**, which is video/mpeg (instead of audio). This is incorrect, but we have to check why this value is in that list. The result is that when you download the file (after you completed the previous config fix), you get a file with an mpeg extension.

#### Re-upload files
After the fixes above, existing mp3 files have to be refreshed so that their content type is refreshed in the db.

- [ ] backport to SN6 if possible and notify AV
- [ ] patch? (change saved content type in db)

items.body:
It is not possible to assign a url containing **uppercase letters** to a sensenet site (for example www.SomeTestUrl.com).

The problem is most likely in the _Site.IsValidSiteUrl_ method: the _uri.Authority_ property check fails in this case.

- [ ] fix and notify TC

items.title: Dealing with API changes during patching
items.body:
**The problem**: when there is a _breaking change in the API used by 3rd party libraries_ that we cannot control, the phase that tries to start the repository with the new libraries will fail because the custom library that is still there was built against the _old API_.

We have to provide a way for developers to **extend the patch** with the updated version of those libraries so that we can copy them over the same way as we copy our new libraries.

### Solution
Two new steps that can be placed into the manifest to the _appropriate position_: the same place where we copy our own new libraries or import new content items. 

- CopyCustomAssemblies
- ImportCustomContent

These steps expect custom libraries and content to be in the following **subfolder inside the patch**: 

- Customization\bin
- Customization\import

This way developers will be able to **compile and put their new libraries and updated content items into the patch** so that it can be executed on their environment.

items.title: Search page is missing
items.body:
When you enter a search phrase into the search box in the top right corner in any of the _workspaces_ (the one with the placeholder text 'Search site' or 'Search workspace'), you get an error message:

> Unknown action. Action: Search

This is because there is **no Search app/page in SN7 yet**.

The reason this issue is here and not in the [sn-workspaces](https://github.com/sensenet/sn-workspaces) repo is that the error is caused by the **ContextSearch** portlet (which is here): that is what tries to load the Search action and redirect to it.

The simpliest solution is to port the Search page from the old BP branch (or from SN6) here. We should check that page: what portlets are on it, which page template it uses, etc. If it is ok, we should move it here.

items.title: Exe arguments
items.body:
These combinations are valid:
- [x] empty: local computer + sensenet
- [ ] **-log:logname**:  local computer + logname
- [ ] **computername**: computername + sensenet
- [ ] **computername -log:logname**:  remote computer + logname
- [ ] **-file:filename**: load from a file

items.title: BUG: MongoDb ReaderStream overrun
items.body:
Open XML text extractor tries read more than available in TextExtractor.cs line:188.

**The bug**: the specification of the System,IO.Stream does not expect any exception if the Seek method oversteps the stream's Length.

**Tasks**:
- [x] Ensure that the Position can be greater than the Length after Seek called.
- [x] Ensure that the overseek does not throws any exception.
- [x] Ensure that the overseeked stream reads nothing.

items.title: ContentQuery in ReferenceField
items.body:
**Symptom**: Reference field in the CTD can collect referred contents by ContentQuery. This query cannot run with the SystemAccount because it is not safe now. 

**Resolution**: Queries in Reference field be safe automatically.

**Explanation**: The ContentQuery text in a CTD is a string constant so it cannot be hacked.
